intro: Osmia maximiliani, commonly known as the Maximilian's mason bee, is a solitary bee species native to the temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Megachilidae family and is characterized by its distinctive black and yellow striped body. The plant it pollinates includes a variety of flowering plants, particularly those in the Asteraceae and Rosaceae families. Osmia maximiliani constructs its nests in hollow stems or artificial nesting blocks, using a unique combination of resin and plant material. This bee plays an important role in pollination and is often cultivated in agricultural settings to enhance crop yields.
